scenario_title: Miscellaneous Insider Data Exfiltration via Privilege Abuse and Social Engineering

why.details: Driven by dissatisfaction and a desire to expose perceived internal misconduct, the insider repeatedly exploited high-level privileges to access and leak sensitive corporate assets—such as network designs and classified documentation—for personal vindication or political signaling.

how.description: Obtained internal access to sensitive systems by requesting higher permission from email admin.
how.procedure: Insider uses trust relationship or existing valid account to escalate access, e.g., requesting administrator level permissions via internal email or privileged delegation.
observable_evidence: Permission request email from privileged user not typical for role
Grant of admin privileges in access logs without standard justification
Use of valid credentials in systems outside usual role scope
how.impact: Acquisition of elevated privileges opens pathway for broad access to sensitive assets.

how.description: Used social engineering to gather credentials from colleagues by direct email solicitation or covert observation.
how.procedure: Insider solicits or obtains credentials from coworkers via phishing or asks for help using impersonation or social manipulation; uses collected credentials to further expand access.
observable_evidence: Phishing-style email sent internally requesting credential sharing
Multiple logon failures or atypical credential use from internal accounts
Unusual account activity using newly acquired credentials
how.impact: Credential compromise allows lateral movement and access to additional systems/data.

how.description: Leveraged unauthorized credentials to read and modify key files in the company.
how.procedure: With elevated or stolen credentials, the insider accesses network shares, internal drives and directories containing design documents, internal reports or architecture diagrams; may also modify or copy files for exfiltration preparation.
observable_evidence: Elevated account accessing network shared drives not normally used by the role
File read/write operations in sensitive folders by privileged account
Directory listing logs for system design/documentation folders by non-typical user
how.impact: Direct access to high-value assets increases risk of theft and misuse of intellectual property.

how.description: Automated the mass collection and download of classified files using custom scripts or data crawlers.
how.procedure: Insider deploys scripts, crawlers or automated tools to search for, compress and bundle classified files and transmit them to external locations via privileged channels or nonstandard exfiltration methods. (See T1119: Automated Collection) :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}
observable_evidence: Scheduled script or automated process triggered during off-hours to copy large data amounts
Compressed archive creation of design documents followed by network outbound transmission
Outbound traffic to non-standard external endpoints at odd hours
how.impact: Large volume IP exfiltration increases potential damage to organization in terms of competitive loss and regulatory exposure.

how.description: Obfuscated tracks by deleting or modifying system logs and using encrypted portable storage for exfiltration.
how.procedure: Insider manipulates or clears logs (e.g., system, security, application) to hide evidence of activity; may also encrypt or modify data files to obscure traces of exfiltration or misuse. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
observable_evidence: Log-deletion entries or gaps in audit logs following privileged access activity
Unexpected changes in file metadata or timestamps consistent with tampering
Use of encryption or obfuscation tools just prior to exfiltration
how.impact: Reduced detectability and increased dwell time raise risk of prolonged compromise and data loss.
